hints.content:
First, let's find the area and perimeter of the striped rectangle.  

[[☃ image 1]]

We can find area of a rectangle by multiplying its length by its width.  
Area $= \greenD{1} \!\times\!\! \greenD9 \!=\!\! \greenD{9} \text{ sq cm}$ 

We find perimeter by adding the lengths of the sides.  
Perimeter $= \greenD{1} \!+\!\! \greenD{1} \!+\!\! \greenD9 \!+\!\! \greenD9 \!=\!\! \greenD{20} \text{ cm}$

options.alt: A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 1 centimeter. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 9 centimeters. !

hints.content:
Next, we find the area and perimeter of the other rectangle. 

$$ | Area | Perimeter
:- | :- | :-
![A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 1 centimeter. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 9 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ca9b7572f87016f2949094d78e827621cfcee624) | $\greenD{1} \!\times\!\! \greenD9 \!=\!\! \greenD{9} \text{ sq cm}$   | $\greenD{1} \!+\!\! \greenD{1} \!+\!\! \greenD9 \!+\!\! \greenD9 \!=\!\! \greenD{20} \text{ cm}$ 
 ![A tall rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 9 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 1 centimeter.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b0335e9ae20fef61e2788575434d9de69d80971b)   | $\gray1 \!\times\!\! \gray9\!=\!\! \gray{9} \text{ sq cm}$  | $\gray1 \!+\!\! \gray1 \!+\!\! \gray9 \!+\!\! \gray9 \!=\!\! \gray{20} \text{ cm}  $

Now, lets compare the area and perimeters of the rectangles.

Area:  
$\greenD{9}\text { sq cm}=\gray{9}\text{ sq cm}$

Perimeter:  
$\greenD{20}\text { cm}=\gray{20}\text{ cm}$
The rectangles have the same area and perimeter.
